snippet: Doctors Without Borders, the medical charity, said the epidemic could worsen because of shortages of latrines and soap.
abstract: Doctors Without Borders reports cholera epidemic threatens Dadaab, Kenya, world's largest refugee camp; more than 540 residents are infected, including children.
lead_paragraph: Doctors Without Borders, the medical charity, said the epidemic could worsen because of shortages of latrines and soap.

headline.main: Kenya Cholera Epidemic Hits World’s Largest Refugee Camp
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Kenya: Cholera Hits Refugee Site
